stream_context.summary: Kaze worked almost exclusively on Course 14, prototyping a cardboard-box set-piece where Mario pulls a strip of packing tape to open a flap and drop into a ‘hell’ sub-area.  He also fixed a severe performance regression, debugged a Bowser-grabbing crash, and talked through upcoming video content.

development_findings.summary: Course 14’s core gimmick is a giant cardboard box that hides a hell stage; Mario must open the box first and then fall inside.
development_findings.quote: "Mario needs to be able to open the zipper and fall into here … it would be a cardboard flap."

development_findings.summary: The original ‘zipper’ idea (from Biobak) was rejected because it felt unfitting; Kaze pivoted to a strip of packing tape that Mario pulls, requiring vertex animation to ‘grow’ as it unpeels.
development_findings.quote: "A zipper feels so unfitting … my next idea would have been to have a piece of tape that you can pull."

development_findings.summary: Technical plan: implement the tape as a very thin, segmented animated actor that extends while Mario walks backward; animation speed and segment count still being tuned.
Outstanding tasks for Course 14 include modelling the Bowser object, the flap itself, Peach-to-the-rescue sequence, and finalising the ‘zipper to hell’ (now tape) mechanic.
development_findings.quote: "We need the Bowser still. We need the flap still. We need the peach to the rescue, and we wanted the zipper to hell."

development_findings.summary: A major performance bug was traced to a leftover ‘infinite draw distance’ setting from another hack; culling distances were reinstated and mountains consolidated into a single material, hugely improving FPS.
development_findings.quote: "The reason it ran poorly is because … the drawing distance for everything [was] set at infinite."

development_findings.summary: Kaze introduced an HD Mario model with jiggle physics on the nose, higher-res textures, 3D buttons, and cleaned-up topology.
development_findings.quote: "He also has new features like his nose jiggles … everything is higher resolution."

development_findings.summary: Kaze located and fixed a Bowser-holding bug that zeroed Mario’s action arg only in certain emulators; root cause was an unconditional intro-scene reset that overwrote state.

A comet-like challenge system called ‘Yoshi Stars’ is planned: 45 optional missions triggered by Yoshis that impose special conditions (e.g., collect red coins with ≤2 A-presses). These will not appear in the next public demo.
development_findings.quote: "I’m planning 45 of those in total … Yoshi will not be in the demo I’m releasing this time."

context_findings.summary: Kaze states he lives in Canada and considers Germany "one of the worst" places to live, reflecting a preference that may influence his work environment.
context_findings.quote: "Germany is the worst country to live in … I am a German living in Canada."

context_findings.summary: He is actively pursuing Twitter monetisation, hitting 250 k impressions in five days and describing it as "making a hell of a bank."
context_findings.quote: "The Twitter monetization grind is going way better than I thought … we hit 250k today."

context_findings.summary: Kaze dislikes producing technical ‘show-off’ features without gameplay purpose, aiming for cohesive mechanics instead of ‘random technology’.
context_findings.quote: "Don’t want to make a ROM-hack exhibiting random technology. That’s not what I’m interested in."

context_findings.summary: He has the coming week off and plans daily streams, including on-stream workouts, indicating current time availability.

biobak.summary: Suggested using a zipper to open the box and provided reference images; continues to give aesthetic feedback during stream.

zeina.summary: Kaze mentioned that "Zena’s friends" were visiting, implying occasional real-life interruptions.

key_stories.title: From Zipper to Tape
key_stories.summary: Course 14 originally featured a zipper that Mario would unzip to access a hell area.  Kaze felt the zipper clashed with the cardboard aesthetic and, after discussing with Biobak, switched to a roll of packing tape that peels back as Mario walks.
key_stories.challenge: Make an opening mechanism that fits a cardboard box theme.
key_stories.process: Rejected zipper, brainstormed alternatives (staples, knife, tape), settled on animated tape with vertex stretching.
key_stories.outcome: Prototype tape actor implemented; animation speed and segment count still being refined.
key_stories.key_quote: "A piece of tape would work, but I’d have to make it grow … it might actually be better and more fitting."

key_stories.title: Infinite Draw Distance Bug
key_stories.summary: Course 14’s frame-rate was extremely poor until Kaze discovered that an ‘infinite draw distance’ flag from a previous project was still active.
key_stories.challenge: Severe performance drop in new level.
key_stories.process: Profiled the scene, realised culling was disabled, reinstated reasonable distances and merged mountain materials.
key_stories.outcome: Performance now “mostly fine,” enabling further detail work.
key_stories.key_quote: "Back from my other ROM-hack, I still had the drawing distance for everything set at infinite."

key_stories.title: Bowser-Grabbing Crash
key_stories.summary: Holding Bowser caused Mario’s action state to reset on Project 64 but not on Nemu, leading to softlocks.
key_stories.challenge: Inconsistent emulator bug when Mario grabs Bowser in Course 14.
key_stories.process: Set breakpoints on action arg, traced overwrite to unconditional intro-scene reset, re-scoped code to avoid zeroing.
key_stories.outcome: Bug fixed; mechanic works across emulators.
key_stories.key_quote: "Something is overwriting the action arg only in this level … it was the reset intro scene running when there is none."
